intro: Helianthopsis subnivea, commonly known as the snow-hued helianthopsis, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are surrounded by a layer of fine, silky hairs, giving it a frost-like appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun exposure, making it well-suited for rocky or sandy environments. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is a popular choice for xeriscaping and rock gardens.
